notes.text:
A security update is now available for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.0 from the Customer Portal.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.0 is a standalone server, based on the Keycloak project, that provides authentication and standards-based single sign-on capabilities for web and mobile applications.

This asynchronous patch is a security update for Red Hat Single Sign-On 7.0.

Security Fix(es):

* It was found that Keycloak did not implement authentication flow correctly. An attacker could use this flaw to construct a phishing URL, from which he could hijack the user's session. This could lead to information disclosure, or permit further possible attacks. (CVE-2016-8609)

Red Hat would like to thank Hiroyuki Wada of Nomura Research Institute, Ltd for reporting this issue.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Single Sign-On security update

notes.text: It was found that the keycloak did not implement authentication flow correctly. An attacker could use this flaw to construct a phishing URL, from which he could hijack the user's session. This could lead to information disclosure, or permit further possible attacks.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: keycloak: account hijacking via auth code fixation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must
log in to download the update). Before applying this update, back up your
existing Red Hat Single Sign-On installation.

vulnerabilities.title: keycloak: account hijacking via auth code fixation
